title: Defining Time
text: Let $$t$$ represent $$5$$ minute intervals since noon.

title: How Many Time Intervals
text: Given $$t$$ represents $$5$$ minute intervals since noon. How many $$5$$ minute intervals are between noon and $$1$$ pm?

title: First-Year Students
text: Using $$t=12$$, if we are given that $$20$$ first-year students arrive every $$5$$ minutes, how many total first-year students arrived between noon to 1pm?

title: Second-Year Students
text: Using $$t=12$$, if we are given that $$15$$ second-year students leave every $$5$$ minutes, how many total second-year students left between noon to 1pm?

title: Consider Initial Students
text: Now that you've calculated the rate of change of increase in first-years and decrease in second-years, how can you consider the total first-years and second-years. Recall that you are given that there are 1,200 first-year and 1,500 second-year students at a rally at noon.

title: Compute the ratio of first-year to second-year students
text: Using the total first-years and second-years in the rally at 1pm, craft a ratio (fraction).
